item.title: Introduction to parallelism in PyTorch
item.description:
Why Parallelism

If you have a single GPU and it’s enough for your needs, you don’t need to bother. But for most serious workloads, that’s not the case. With care, you can often get nearâ€‘linear training speedups when using more accelerators. Parallelism is a fundamental topic in ML interviews and in any Research Engineer knowledge.

In this blog post I’ll cover the most commonly used methods for parallelism: DDP, FSDP, and TP. In the next post, I’ll show how to write kernels and use FP8 for maximum efficiency.
